text: well whenever it's Vladimir Putin's
birthday strange things tend to happen
in Russian and what's happening behind
me now is quite frankly very strange
it's an art exhibition comparing
President Putin to the Greek hero
Hercules and it's been organized by the
so called Vladimir Putin supporters
group now Hercules was the son of Zeus
and so the story goes he carried out 12
labors 12 incredibly difficult tasks and
here those tasks have been redrawn
reinterpreted to represent Vladimir
Putin's deeds in the Kremlin for example
instead of Hercules slaying the Nemean
lion
here we see Vladimir Putin battling
terrorism and next door whereas Hercules
took on the multi-headed Hydra
here we see Vladimir Putin battling the
European Union Japan Canada and the
United States his response to Western
sanctions I would use Hercules and the
Cretan bull or rather Vladimir Putin
annexing the Crimea smarted shown a set
of should kill digital torre√≥n a shifter
an even artificially news story this has
been part of our culture for a thousand
years a strong leader has always been at
the center of society here and we the
people have trusted them bazaars the
Emperor's general secretaries of the
Communist Party Vladimir Putin continues
the tradition it's hard to imagine an
exhibition like this in London or
Washington comparing David Cameron or
Barack Obama to mythological heroes but
Russia is different and certainly over
the 15 years that Vladimir Putin has
been in power something of a personality
cult has built up around him now the
Kremlin has claimed many times in the
past but it's had nothing to do with
that it hasn't encouraged that but
Kremlin critics don't believe it
what is true though is that despite the

at Western politicians and even Hercules
